According to Wallace, they were hassling his limo driver, he was merely trying to ask what the problem was. One of the meter maids got confrontational and violent and cuffed him. Charging him with "disorderly conduct".
 
 You have to be either retarded or very insecure in your manhood to feel the need to handcuff an 86 year old man. Especially a man who's face is known virtually world wide.
 
 I'm guessing his days as a meter maid are over. He'll have to move on to being a mall rent a cop.

Sounds like y'all know how to figure things out without seeing any evidence. I understand that the limo was double parked (illegal). Wallace shouldn't have had to ask what was going on.

georged

True, but until we became so politically correct and paranoid from antagonizing most of the world with our aggressive foreign policy and support of Israel resulting in retaliation, all the NYC limo drivers I ever used always settled those misunderstandings with a little green and the city kept functioning. Waxy

Sounds like y'all know how to figure things out without seeing any evidence. I understand that the limo was double parked (illegal). Wallace shouldn't have had to ask what was going on.
 
 Wallace's notoriety does not put him above the law. Neither does his age.

 
 Typical. :p
 
 I can definately see you slapping the cuffs on an 86 year old man for double parking his limo and asking questions - aka "questioning your authority". :p
 
 Why should he not ask what was going on? They were spending, what to him anyway, seemed like an inordinate amount of time and agressively questioning his driver. He wanted to know why. Is that wrong? Should he just shut up and assume the "cops" had only his best interest and fairness in mind? 
 
 Admittedly, I don't have all the facts, but unless Wallace was taking a swing at the guy, he overreacted. Plain and simple IMHO. What can an 86 year old man really do that poses a threat to the parking cops or creates a situation which required his arrest? What happened to common sense? What happened to level headed justice?
 
 Cops get yelled at every day, it's basically part of their job. It's also part of their job to not act on emotion and not to respond in kind. They are trained to that very extent. Cuffing an 86 year old man and "sending him to the station" for a verbal exchange over a double parked limo is, IMHO, rediculous, and is not in line with the standards expected of a professional in law enforcement.
 
 I don't care if he's Mike Wallace or Joe Sixpack.
 
 Waxy

Mike wallace was hauled off to jail yesterday after getting confrontational with NY City Meter Maids. What is the world coming to. 
 
 
 
 there side is 
"Wallace appeared to lunge toward one of the two inspectors. The other inspector became concerned with his partner's safety and at that point cuffed Mr. Wallace." 
 
 if true, then he deserved to go to jail, if his version is true 
"For whatever reason, this guy and his buddy were intent upon telling me that I was interfering with the execution of the law." 
 then the cos need new jobs
 
 as for cuffing him, if you cuff one person going to jail, you need to cuff everybody going to jail. other wise you are opning up the department to clames of descrimation.
Waxy

there side is 
 if true, then he deserved to go to jail, if his version is true then the cos need new jobs
 
 as for cuffing him, if you cuff one person going to jail, you need to cuff everybody going to jail. other wise you are opning up the department to clames of descrimation.

 
 "Wallace appeared to lunge toward one of the two inspectors. The other inspector became concerned with his partner's safety and at that point cuffed Mr. Wallace."  
 
 LOL. An 86 year old man "lunged toward him" and he became so concerned for his safety that he determined handcuffs were required? It's comical. Maybe Wallace just lost his balance on his bad hip or his heart was just beating a little too fast. I mean really, where is common sense? These are suppossedly trained peace officers.
 
 Further to that, why on earth was the situation ever allowed to escalate to the point that the officers felt there was a threat from Wallace? They were just handing out a traffic ticket, why the alleged attitude? Respected and lawful citizens like Mike Wallace don't just go off on a cop to the point of being arrested over a routine ticket for being double parked, especially without some sort of reason to incite them. That's absurd. Something doesn't add up.
 
 I agree about cuffing everyone going to jail - it's the decision to take him to jail that I find rather amusing, and disturbing.
 
 Waxy
Bush Is The Man

[B]LOL. An 86 year old man "lunged toward him" and he became so concerned for his safety that he determined handcuffs were required? It's comical. Maybe Wallace just lost his balance on his bad hip or his heart was just beating a little too fast. I mean really, where is common sense? These are suppossedly trained peace officers.

 
 
 
 Like many others have said, I don't know what exactly happened with this incident. I know this may sounds absurd, but what if Wallace had a gun or knife? He obviously didn't, but what if he did? The law doesn't state that once you hit 85 you can lunge at an officer. It applies to everyone. So if he did what they said he did, I agree that they should have cuffed him. Then they should have sat him down and asked why he did what he did. I do not think he should have went to jail.
 
 
 
Further to that, why on earth was the situation ever allowed to escalate to the point that the officers felt there was a threat from Wallace? They were just handing out a traffic ticket, why the alleged attitude? Respected and lawful citizens like Mike Wallace don't just go off on a cop to the point of being arrested over a routine ticket for being double parked, especially without some sort of reason to incite them. That's absurd. Something doesn't add up.

 
 
 
 That is a generalization. Many repected and lawful citizens do crazy things that nobody thought they would do. Remember the lady who drove her car repeatedly over her husband, killing him. I doubt that he knew it was coming. Look at Martin Lawrence and Robert Blake. Some people just harness in all of their anger and one little thing can put them over the edge. I'm not saying that Wallace fits this category, but it often happens.

 By the way, I agree that this is comical and hardly worth any news time. Waxy

By the way, I agree that this is comical and hardly worth any news time. BUT, I have to say is it POSSIBLE that Wallace is an arrogant XXXXX who feels he is above these lowly officers who would DARE to give him a ticket, or at the very least cause him inconvenience? You have to admit, that many celebrities (and not saying anything about right and left politics) feel they ARE above us little folk

 
 I don't doubt this is possible at all, maybe even probable.
 
 The fact remains IMHO, that it is the "cops" job to deal with the XXXXX, and regardless of his attitude, they could have and SHOULD have handled the matter professionally. IMHO, that means answer his question, be blunt but polite, and difuse the situation rather than escalate it and create a mountain out of a mole hill. That was all that was required. These guys, contrary to what they might think, are not CIA operatives hunting down terrorists. An 86 year old man with meatloaf and potatoes in hands did not pose a threat to their safety.
 
 I'm sure there are two sides to the story, my point is, there shouldn't be a story if the "cops" acted properly.
 
 Waxy
